text: It's that time now where we can finally put...
everything we've learned so far in Module 1 and Module 2 into a very concise template
that we can complete on a day-to-day basis and even on the weekend.
So it's crucial that you not only have a look at the template that I'm going to show
you and go through with you step-by-step, but make sure that you utilize this template
and complete it on a daily basis, because this will remind you of all the principles
It will help you identify early observations and make much better trading decisions.
So note that the template is broken up into four major sections.
The first will be the value area placement.
So where the value area is trading relative, in relative to the previous day and maybe
Then, the template will talk about the attempted direction, so where we open, where we close
and where is value being accepted, so just giving us a little bit of a relative understanding
about the attempted direction and who's in control.
We'll then talk, or the template will then show us and talk about profile shape, you
know, have we got symmetry or non-symmetry, have we got balance or no balance, are we
trending or not trending, and are we, you know, sort of showing bracketing or trending
type markets.
And then volume, our template will show us a little bit about relative volume, relative
ranges and all sorts of relative statistics that we can utilize.
So with these four major pillars, let's not go into the template, let's get up a basic
example, let's complete this template together so you can get a better understanding of
what we've dealt with so far in module 1 and module 2.
